page.title: 01IMPRESSIONS OF THE AREA
page.content: This is a very quiet and remote part of Herefordshire. There is one village, King's Caple, a few farms, and a lot of countryside. The people in King's Caple were very friendly and helpful, and the ones we met were most interested in their community and knew everyone else. They seem to know their neighbours and their neighbourhood much better than town people do. There are some lovely old houses, and everyone seems to care about their surroundings. They do not want them changed, and they care about the countryside. There are some large farms and a man who trains gun-dogs. The River Wye winds through the area and it is very good for fishing and canoeing. Like other parts of the county, people sell things like Christmas trees and eggs and vegetables from their homes.
